seg.input:
- - - turas. Ecce copiae cornu. Si interpretationi diffidis, en locum loco illustravimus. Iudicet unctio potius quam carnis pollute tenebre. An ne patres audire cupis? Quis antiquior Tertulliano? Quis diligentior Lactantio? Quis denique pientior et doctior Cypriano? Rem fortassis novam aut inauditam causaris; quid vero inaudita? Quis unquam apostolorum panem hunc ita tractavit? Quis unquam primitivae ecclesie eum dei loco habuit? Unde, queso, has voces delatas dices: transubstantiatio [!], accidens, substantia, forma? An non titulotenus christianum impostrice philosophia submersum Thomam aut Scotum olfacis? Siccine odorandi organo privatus es, ut amodo nescias pium ab impio, peregrinum a domestico, aut denique aquam a vino secernere? Persequtionem vero ob veritatem adeo abest, ut te vereri posse credam, ut ad apostolorum exemplum eius rei causa gaudere et exultare te iam iam spiritu videam. Restat ergo, ut impietate adorandi abnegata vitam tuam ad litterarum praescriptum emendes. Et quid impientius eidololatria? Quis vero non tangit panis adorationem longe impudentissimam eidololatriam in iniuriam dei vergere?
Audi, quid spiritus dei eidolatris promittat: «Et tertius angelus» etc. [Apk 14,9ff]. Ego (ut primo hoc moneam) nulla parte iis accedo, qui ita plane hunc librum abiiciunt; tanta enim mysteria et tam diligentem scripturarum citationem, tantam consolationem in cruce et tantam in eo deprehendo diligentiam in resurrectione explicanda, ut mirari nequeam, cur ydem [!] alii oculati Argi non viderint. Sed hec, ut exordinaria, ita rursus in orbem nobis redeundum. Hoc docet apostolus fore imaginem quandam bestie, hoc est pape, quam qui adoraverit, signo in hoc, ut imagini ministrare possit, in manus assumpto [Apk 14,9], hoc est unctione episcopali, is sit passurus horrenda illa tormenta, quae recencet [!] apostolus. Scilicet: «Bibiturus est is de vino ire» [Apk 14,10], hoc est, ira dei cadet in eum, ut in cecitate de peccato abeat in scelus et de scelere in nephas: Rom. 1 [18ff]. Inductus in eam falsa doctrina pape, que interim pietatis speciem habet; id quod Ioannes vocat «mixtum mero» [Apk 14,10], ad similitudinem Esaie: «Vinum tuum mixtum est aqua» etc. [Jes 1,22]. Quamquam non ignoro, quam aegre hec de sacramento sententia carni persuadeatur, neque mirum, cum tot a Christo ipso, cui et gratia et authoritas cum loquendi tum docendi aderat, eo ipso tempore, cum eandem Camerinam [!] moveret, desciverint; ut legimus Ioan. 6 [66].
Quartus iam annus agitur, ut nosti, quod huius sententiae esse incipio, et certe tantum me in hac causa torsi, ut ab hoc man veluti parum integre sanitatis pisciculus toties eiectus, sepissime de vita desperaverim. Sed gratia deo, qui mihi ita meam pacavit conscientiam, ut nunc ne tantillum quidem, etiam cum totum [?] mare [?] importunissimis procellis sevit, animum meum ex [?] sacra [?] anchora dimoveat. Precorque deum, ut hanc tibi sententiam, si modo vera est, de qua re minime dubito, ceterisque fratribus ita adaperiat, ut vere, hoc est in spiritu incipiatis verum, solum et omnipotentem deum adorare [Joh 4,24]. Cui gloria et imperium semper [Mt 6,13].
Sylvam [!] vero hanc, hoc est rudem et impolitam argumentorum congeriem sive materiam boni, queso, consule; nam nitidiora aut etiam copiosiora occupationes non permisere. Tu ora pro me et ecclesia domini nostri Jesu Christi, ut eam quotidie magis adaugeat, ita ut dignum honorem et gloriam habeat.
Gratia tecum.
Ex eremo mea, 17. aprilis 1525.
Salutabis Wernhereum [!] Steiner et alios in Christo fratres.
Erudito et vere pio viro Leoni Jud, fratri in Christo dilecto.
seg.output:
Listen, what the Spirit of God promises to the idolaters: "And the third angel..." etc. [Apk 14,9ff]. I (to remind you first of this) do not agree with those who reject this book so thoroughly; for I find in it so many mysteries, such diligent citation of texts, such consolation in the cross and such diligence in explaining the resurrection, that I wonder why the same [!] Argus have not seen it. But this, as an ordinary, so again return to us. This teaches that there will be a certain image of the beast, that is, the pope, who, taking the sign in his hands in order to be able to serve the image [Apk 14,9], that is, by the episcopal unction, will suffer those horrible torments which the apostle enumerates [!]. Namely: "He will drink of the wine of the wrath of God" [Apk 14,10], that is, the anger of God will fall on him, so that in blindness he will go from sin to crime and from crime to blasphemy: Rom. 1 [18ff]. Induced by that false doctrine of the pope, which meanwhile has the appearance of piety; which John calls "mixed with wine" [Apk 14,10], according to Isaiah: "Your wine is mixed with water" etc. [Jes 1,22]. Although I do not ignore how hard this opinion about the sacrament is for the flesh to believe, nor is it strange, since so many have deviated from Christ himself, to whom grace and authority were given both to speak and to teach, at the same time when he was raising the same [!] Camerinam [!], as we read in John 6 [66].
You know that the fourth year is already running, since I began to be of this opinion, and surely I have been so much tormented in this cause that I have often despaired of life, like a little fish of little health, thrown out of this man so often. But by the grace of God, who has pacified my conscience so that now it does not move my spirit even a little, even when the whole [?] sea [?] is raging with the most violent storms, from the holy [?] anchor. And I pray to God that he may open this opinion to you, if it is true, of which I doubt nothing, and to the other brothers, that they may truly, that is, in spirit, begin to worship the true, only and omnipotent God [John 4:24]. To whom be glory and power forever [Mt 6:13].
But I ask you to consult this wild and unpolished heap of arguments or materials for good; for occupations have not allowed more or even brighter. Pray for me and for the church of our Lord Jesus Christ, that it may daily increase more and more, so that it may have a worthy honor and glory.
Grace be with you.
From my wilderness, April 17th, 1525.
Greet Wernhereum [!] Steiner and other brothers in Christ.
To the learned and truly pious Leoni Jud, beloved brother in Christ.
